unzip.h

00001 /* unzip.h -- IO for uncompress .zip files using zlib 
00002    Version 0.18 beta, Feb 26th, 2002
00003 
00004    Copyright (C) 1998-2002 Gilles Vollant
00005 
00006    This unzip package allow extract file from .ZIP file, compatible with PKZip 2.04g
00007      WinZip, InfoZip tools and compatible.
00008    Encryption and multi volume ZipFile (span) are not supported.
00009    Old compressions used by old PKZip 1.x are not supported
00010 
00011    THIS IS AN ALPHA VERSION. AT THIS STAGE OF DEVELOPPEMENT, SOMES API OR STRUCTURE
00012    CAN CHANGE IN FUTURE VERSION !!
00013    I WAIT FEEDBACK at mail info@winimage.com
00014    Visit also http://www.winimage.com/zLibDll/unzip.htm for evolution
00015 
00016    Condition of use and distribution are the same than zlib :
00017 
00018   This software is provided 'as-is', without any express or implied
00019   warranty.  In no event will the authors be held liable for any damages
00020   arising from the use of this software.
00021 
00022   Permission is granted to anyone to use this software for any purpose,
00023   including commercial applications, and to alter it and redistribute it
00024   freely, subject to the following restrictions:
00025 
00026   1. The origin of this software must not be misrepresented; you must not
00027      claim that you wrote the original software. If you use this software
00028      in a product, an acknowledgment in the product documentation would be
00029      appreciated but is not required.
00030   2. Altered source versions must be plainly marked as such, and must not be

00037 /* for more info about .ZIP format, see 
00038       http://www.info-zip.org/pub/infozip/doc/appnote-981119-iz.zip
00039       http://www.info-zip.org/pub/infozip/doc/
00040    PkWare has also a specification at :
00041       ftp://ftp.pkware.com/probdesc.zip
00042 */
00043 
00044 #ifndef _unz_H
00045 #define _unz_H
00046 
00047 #ifdef __cplusplus
00048 extern "C" {
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 #ifndef _ZLIB_H
00052 #include "zlib.h"
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #ifndef _ZLIBIOAPI_H
00056 #include "ioapi.h"
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #if defined(STRICTUNZIP) || defined(STRICTZIPUNZIP)
00060 /* like the STRICT of WIN32, we define a pointer that cannot be converted
00061     from (void*) without cast */
00062 typedef struct TagunzFile__ { int unused; } unzFile__; 
00063 typedef unzFile__ *unzFile;
00064 #else
00065 typedef voidp unzFile;
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 
00069 #define UNZ_OK                                  (0)
00070 #define UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE (-100)
00071 #define UNZ_ERRNO               (Z_ERRNO)
00072 #define UNZ_EOF                 (0)
00073 #define UNZ_PARAMERROR                  (-102)
00074 #define UNZ_BADZIPFILE                  (-103)
00075 #define UNZ_INTERNALERROR               (-104)
00076 #define UNZ_CRCERROR                    (-105)
00077 
00078 /* tm_unz contain date/time info */
00079 typedef struct tm_unz_s 
00080 {
00081         uInt tm_sec;            /* seconds after the minute - [0,59] */
00082         uInt tm_min;            /* minutes after the hour - [0,59] */
00083         uInt tm_hour;           /* hours since midnight - [0,23] */
00084         uInt tm_mday;           /* day of the month - [1,31] */
00085         uInt tm_mon;            /* months since January - [0,11] */
00086         uInt tm_year;           /* years - [1980..2044] */
00087 } tm_unz;
00088 
00089 /* unz_global_info structure contain global data about the ZIPfile
00090    These data comes from the end of central dir */
00091 typedef struct unz_global_info_s
00092 {
00093         uLong number_entry;         /* total number of entries in
00094                                        the central dir on this disk */
00095         uLong size_comment;         /* size of the global comment of the zipfile */
00096 } unz_global_info;
00097 
00098 
00099 /* unz_file_info contain information about a file in the zipfile */
00100 typedef struct unz_file_info_s
00101 {
00102     uLong version;              /* version made by                 2 bytes */
00103     uLong version_needed;       /* version needed to extract       2 bytes */
00104     uLong flag;                 /* general purpose bit flag        2 bytes */
00105     uLong compression_method;   /* compression method              2 bytes */
00106     uLong dosDate;              /* last mod file date in Dos fmt   4 bytes */
00107     uLong crc;                  /* crc-32                          4 bytes */
00108     uLong compressed_size;      /* compressed size                 4 bytes */ 
00109     uLong uncompressed_size;    /* uncompressed size               4 bytes */ 
00110     uLong size_filename;        /* filename length                 2 bytes */
00111     uLong size_file_extra;      /* extra field length              2 bytes */
00112     uLong size_file_comment;    /* file comment length             2 bytes */
00113 
00114     uLong disk_num_start;       /* disk number start               2 bytes */
00115     uLong internal_fa;          /* internal file attributes        2 bytes */
00116     uLong external_fa;          /* external file attributes        4 bytes */
00117 
00118     tm_unz tmu_date;
00119 } unz_file_info;
00120 
00121 extern int ZEXPORT unzStringFileNameCompare OF ((const char* fileName1,
00122                                                                                                  const char* fileName2,
00123                                                                                                  int iCaseSensitivity));
00124 /*
00125    Compare two filename (fileName1,fileName2).
00126    If iCaseSenisivity = 1, comparision is case sensitivity (like strcmp)
00127    If iCaseSenisivity = 2, comparision is not case sensitivity (like strcmpi
00128                                                                 or strcasecmp)
00129    If iCaseSenisivity = 0, case sensitivity is defaut of your operating system
00130         (like 1 on Unix, 2 on Windows)
00131 */
00132 
00133 
00134 extern unzFile ZEXPORT unzOpen OF((const char *path));
00135 /*
00136   Open a Zip file. path contain the full pathname (by example,
00137      on a Windows XP computer "c:\\zlib\\zlib113.zip" or on an Unix computer
00138          "zlib/zlib113.zip".
00139          If the zipfile cannot be opened (file don't exist or in not valid), the
00140            return value is NULL.
00141      Else, the return value is a unzFile Handle, usable with other function
00142            of this unzip package.
00143 */
00144 
00145 extern unzFile ZEXPORT unzOpen2 OF((const char *path,
00146                                     zlib_filefunc_def* pzlib_filefunc_def));
00147 /*
00148    Open a Zip file, like unzOpen, but provide a set of file low level API 
00149       for read/write the zip file (see ioapi.h)
00150 */
00151 
00152 extern int ZEXPORT unzClose OF((unzFile file));
00153 /*
00154   Close a ZipFile opened with unzipOpen.
00155   If there is files inside the .Zip opened with unzOpenCurrentFile (see later),
00156     these files MUST be closed with unzipCloseCurrentFile before call unzipClose.
00157   return UNZ_OK if there is no problem. */
00158 
00159 extern int ZEXPORT unzGetGlobalInfo OF((unzFile file,
00160                                         unz_global_info *pglobal_info));
00161 /*
00162   Write info about the ZipFile in the *pglobal_info structure.
00163   No preparation of the structure is needed
00164   return UNZ_OK if there is no problem. */
00165 
00166 
00167 extern int ZEXPORT unzGetGlobalComment OF((unzFile file,
00168                                                                                    char *szComment,
00169                                            uLong uSizeBuf));
00170 /*
00171   Get the global comment string of the ZipFile, in the szComment buffer.
00172   uSizeBuf is the size of the szComment buffer.
00173   return the number of byte copied or an error code <0
00174 */
00175 
00176 
00177 /***************************************************************************/
00178 /* Unzip package allow you browse the directory of the zipfile */
00179 
00180 extern int ZEXPORT unzGoToFirstFile OF((unzFile file));
00181 /*
00182   Set the current file of the zipfile to the first file.
00183   return UNZ_OK if there is no problem
00184 */
00185 
00186 extern int ZEXPORT unzGoToNextFile OF((unzFile file));
00187 /*
00188   Set the current file of the zipfile to the next file.
00189   return UNZ_OK if there is no problem
00190   return UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE if the actual file was the latest.
00191 */
00192 
00193 extern int ZEXPORT unzLocateFile OF((unzFile file, 
00194                                      const char *szFileName,
00195                                      int iCaseSensitivity));
00196 /*
00197   Try locate the file szFileName in the zipfile.
00198   For the iCaseSensitivity signification, see unzStringFileNameCompare
00199 
00200   return value :
00201   UNZ_OK if the file is found. It becomes the current file.
00202   UNZ_END_OF_LIST_OF_FILE if the file is not found
00203 */
00204 
00205 
00206 extern int ZEXPORT unzGetCurrentFileInfo OF((unzFile file,
00207                                              unz_file_info *pfile_info,
00208                                              char *szFileName,
00209                                              uLong fileNameBufferSize,
00210                                              void *extraField,
00211                                              uLong extraFieldBufferSize,
00212                                              char *szComment,
00213                                              uLong commentBufferSize));
00214 /*
00215   Get Info about the current file
00216   if pfile_info!=NULL, the *pfile_info structure will contain somes info about
00217             the current file
00218   if szFileName!=NULL, the filemane string will be copied in szFileName
00219                         (fileNameBufferSize is the size of the buffer)
00220   if extraField!=NULL, the extra field information will be copied in extraField
00221                         (extraFieldBufferSize is the size of the buffer).
00222                         This is the Central-header version of the extra field
00223   if szComment!=NULL, the comment string of the file will be copied in szComment
00224                         (commentBufferSize is the size of the buffer)
00225 */
00226 
00227 /***************************************************************************/
00228 /* for reading the content of the current zipfile, you can open it, read data
00229    from it, and close it (you can close it before reading all the file)
00230    */
00231 
00232 extern int ZEXPORT unzOpenCurrentFile OF((unzFile file));
00233 /*
00234   Open for reading data the current file in the zipfile.
00235   If there is no error, the return value is UNZ_OK.
00236 */
00237 
00238 extern int ZEXPORT unzOpenCurrentFile2 OF((unzFile file,
00239                                            int* method,
00240                                            int* level,
00241                                            int raw));
00242 /*
00243   Same than unzOpenCurrentFile, but open for read raw the file (not uncompress)
00244   *method will receive method of compression, *level will receive level of 
00245      compression
00246   note : you can set level parameter as NULL (if you did not want known level,
00247          but you CANNOT set method parameter as NULL
00248 */
00249 
00250 extern int ZEXPORT unzCloseCurrentFile OF((unzFile file));
00251 /*
00252   Close the file in zip opened with unzOpenCurrentFile
00253   Return UNZ_CRCERROR if all the file was read but the CRC is not good
00254 */
00255                                                                                 
00256 extern int ZEXPORT unzReadCurrentFile OF((unzFile file, 
00257                                           voidp buf,
00258                                           unsigned len));
00259 /*
00260   Read bytes from the current file (opened by unzOpenCurrentFile)
00261   buf contain buffer where data must be copied
00262   len the size of buf.
00263 
00264   return the number of byte copied if somes bytes are copied
00265   return 0 if the end of file was reached
00266   return <0 with error code if there is an error
00267     (UNZ_ERRNO for IO error, or zLib error for uncompress error)
00268 */
00269 
00270 extern z_off_t ZEXPORT unztell OF((unzFile file));
00271 /*
00272   Give the current position in uncompressed data
00273 */
00274 
00275 extern int ZEXPORT unzeof OF((unzFile file));
00276 /*
00277   return 1 if the end of file was reached, 0 elsewhere 
00278 */
00279 
00280 extern int ZEXPORT unzGetLocalExtrafield OF((unzFile file,
00281                                                                                          voidp buf,
00282                                                                                          unsigned len));
00283 /*
00284   Read extra field from the current file (opened by unzOpenCurrentFile)
00285   This is the local-header version of the extra field (sometimes, there is
00286     more info in the local-header version than in the central-header)
00287 
00288   if buf==NULL, it return the size of the local extra field
00289 
00290   if buf!=NULL, len is the size of the buffer, the extra header is copied in
00291         buf.
00292   the return value is the number of bytes copied in buf, or (if <0) 
00293         the error code
00294 */
00295 
00296 #ifdef __cplusplus
00297 }
00298 #endif

00300 #endif /* _unz_H */
